thread.title: Make this one change NOW to save £292 a year
thread.title_full: Make this one change NOW to save £292 a year

title: Make this one change NOW to save £292 a year
text:
Make this one change NOW to save £292 a year Make this one change NOW to save £292 a year THE cheapest energy deal in more than four years has been launched providing British households with a typical saving of almost £300 a year. PUBLISHED: 07:41, Fri, Oct 2, 2015 | UPDATED: 08:27, Fri, Oct 2, 2015 GETTY Seven out of ten homes could save money by switching their energy bill 
E.ON's new dual fuel tariff is a 12 month fix and gives homes an £803 average bill - that's £28 cheaper than the next cheapest deal on the market and a typical saving of £292. The offer is only available through comparison site Uswitch.com until November 3, but comes with an early exit fee of £30. The E.ON deal is the result of a collective switch initiative where purchasing power is used to negotiate a cheaper deal.A whopping seven in ten British homes could change supplier to benefit from a cheaper bills, showed recent research by the competition regulator.Households on big six standard variable plans could collectively save in the region of £5.4billion by switching to the new deal, according to Uswitch.com. As the weather turns colder, households have been urged to source the best possible deal on their gas and electricity to avoid paying more than necessary. Related articles
